titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Barbara Beisinghoff Collection, approximately 2000-2005
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2015

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: 6 of Beisinghoff's art pieces inspired by Christa Wolf’s Kassandra.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Barbara Beisinghoff is a German artist known for her etchings, artists' books, and use of watermarks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Six handmade papers with watermarks. All the watermarked words are taken from the novel Kassandra. of Christa Wolf. Christa Wolf authorizised Barbara Beisinghoff to use her sentences for her art work. Wolf and Beisinghoff carried on correspondence, and met each other in Berlin Pankow, Amalienpark 7, where Gerhard Wolf, Christa Wolf’s husband lived.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library also holds a number of Beisinghoff's artists books.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Barbara Beisinghoff Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
